eventData.headline: Yale Library Ask Me Anything
eventData.description:
Get to Know the Yale Library. Come learn about Yale’s library system, and the role it plays in the lives of Yale students. Bring your questions about the best study spaces, Yale’s unusual collections, getting a job in the library, and finding out about your personal librarians.

Newly admitted students are also welcome to contact emily.horning@yale.edu with questions.

https://yale.zoom.us/j/92487857770

eventType.name: Academic Departments & Programs
eventType.description: Get to know more about some academic departments & programs at Yale through these live events.

eventData.headline: Economics, CS & Economics, & Economics & Mathematics
eventData.description:
So glad you are interested in learning more about majoring in economics at Yale. Reasonably given its name, many people think economics is the study of the economy including recessions and inflation and perhaps stocks and bonds as well. While macroeconomics and finance are important parts of the field, economics in general and at Yale is a much broader field.  Are you interested in understanding….
  • How a charity should design its appeals to raise more money?
  • What interventions help poor people to attain more prosperous outcomes? 
  • How national health reform is affecting the nation’s health and wealth?
  • How international trade affects the environment? 
  • Why there are gender and racial wage gaps?
 Then come explore economics at Yale and learn more about the three economics undergraduate majors during this session.

https://yale.zoom.us/j/98979965153?pwd=cHI3alE0aWYxVkNGay83OHVEcVV4UT09Participants:Philipp%20Strack,%20DUS%20CS&Econstudents%20representing%20each%20of%20the%20thre%20majors

eventType.name: Cultural Centers
eventType.description: These events are created in coordination with the cultural centers and student groups that operate within them.

eventData.headline: Welcome to the AfAm House: Leadership Q&A
eventData.description:
Join the Afro-American Cultural Center’s Director (Dean Risë Nelson), Assistant Director (Sofia Lackiram) and a few student staff members, on April 13th from 5:30pm-7pm EST, for a captivating q&a session. This event is open to admitted students, families, parents and/or caregivers.At this event, you’ll learn about how the center (affectionately known as ‘The House’) can be your home away from home! We’ll share a brief overview of the House, its mission and purpose, along with the various resources we have to offer. You’ll also have the opportunity to hear first hand perspectives of both experiences at the House and Black Student Life on campus, from current Yalies.  We look forward to meeting you! Questions? Email: afamhouse@yale.edu

https://yale.zoom.us/j/92162326134?pwd=bXBGdDE1YU1RSmVVVGlqR1FwWHcwZz09
pw: AfAm2021

eventData.headline: Nigerian Trivia Night
eventData.description:
Join YNSA for an entertaining and light-hearted trivia night on April 13th! Our categories will cover various aspects of the Nigerian culture, such as food, history, and famous celebrities. This is a low-stakes environment and a great opportunity to interact with other Nigerians at Yale!

eventData.description:

We'll be 'speed-friending', and you'll have a chance to question current students, share a little bit about yourself, and learn about some of your potential classmates. eventData.headline: SovereignTEA: Bulldog Days Edition
eventData.description:
The Native American Cultural Center (NACC) peer liaisons will be hosting SovereignTEA: Bulldogs Days Edition Tuesday, April 13 at 8:00pm! SovereignTEA during the semester is a casual gathering at the NACC, where students talk about anything from favorite TV shows to how their week is going. The Bulldog Days edition will follow the same format allowing new admits and current students to get to know each other in casual conversations.

https://yale.zoom.us/j/94725181455?pwd=MmlVWXVhcVVVbWdZcW9ueFgwSHRlUT09&from=addon

eventType.name: Master Classes
eventType.description: An opportunity to learn and experience a class from one of Yale's notable professors.

eventData.headline: Demers: The Energy Frontier at CERN's Large Hadron Collider
eventData.description:
Sarah Demers is the Horace Taft Associate Professor of Physics. Her laboratory uses tau leptons to probe for and characterize physics beyond the standard model at CERN’s Large Hadron Collider. Demers’ current projects include the search for a Higgs boson that decays to tau pairs and a measure of tau polarization in Z boson decays. In addition, she works on the trigger for the experiment and co-leads the ATLAS Data Quality Group. Professor Demers’s courses, which include “The Physics of Dance,” and "Fundamentals of Physics,” are renowned for their interdisciplinary focus and innovative approach to teaching and learning. Professor Demers is the recipient of Yale’s Provost Teacher Award and the Yale Poorvu Family Award for Interdisciplinary Teaching.

A zoom link for this event will be posted an hour prior to the start time.
eventData.locationText: A zoom link for this event will be posted an hour prior to the start time.

eventType.name: Master Classes
eventType.description: An opportunity to learn and experience a class from one of Yale's notable professors.

eventData.headline: Chun: Mind Reading with Brain Imaging & Neuroscience at Yale
eventData.description:
Marvin Chun is Dean of Yale College and the Richard M. Colgate Professor of Psychology, with secondary appointments in the Cognitive Science Program and the Yale School of Medicine Department of Neuroscience. Professor Chun is a cognitive neuroscientist whose research interests include using functional brain imaging, neuroimaging (fMRI), and behavioral techniques to understand how to improve memory, attention, conscious perception, and decision-making. At the undergraduate level, he teaches “Introduction to Psychology,” for which he received the Phi Beta Kappa William Clyde DeVane Medal for Distinguished Scholarship and Teaching in Yale College, and the Lex Hixon ‘63 Prize for Teaching Excellence in the Social Sciences.

A zoom link for this event will be posted an hour prior to the start time.
